verses.verse: When I would have healed<WH7495> Israel<WH3478>, then the iniquity<WH5771> of Ephraim<WH669> was discovered<WH1540>, and the wickedness<WH7451> of Samaria<WH8111>: for they commit<WH6466> falsehood<WH8267>; and the thief<WH1590> comes in<WH935>, and the troop<WH1416> of robbers spoils<WH6584> outside<WH2351>.
And they consider<WH559> not in their hearts<WH3824> that I remember<WH2142> all their wickedness<WH7451>: now their own doings<WH4611> have beset them about<WH5437>; they are before my face<WH6440>.
They make the king<WH4428> glad<WH8055> with their wickedness<WH7451>, and the princes<WH8269> with their lies<WH3585>.

They are all adulterers<WH5003>, as a oven<WH8574> heated<WH1197> by the baker<WH644>, who ceases<WH7673> from raising<WH5782> after he has kneaded<WH3888> the dough<WH1217>, until it be leavened<WH2556>.
In the day<WH3117> of our king<WH4428> the princes<WH8269> have made him sick<WH2470> with bottles<WH2534> of wine<WH3196>; he stretched out<WH4900> his hand<WH3027> with scorners<WH3945>.

For they have made ready<WH7126> their heart<WH3820> like a oven<WH8574>, while they lie in wait<WH693>: their baker<WH644> sleeps<WH3463> all the night<WH3915>; in the morning<WH1242> it burns<WH1197> as a flaming<WH3852> fire<WH784>.
They are all hot<WH2552> as a oven<WH8574>, and have devoured<WH398> their judges<WH8199>; all their kings<WH4428> are fallen<WH5307>: there is none among them that calls unto me<WH7121>.
Ephraim<WH669>, he has mixed<WH1101> himself among the people<WH5971>; Ephraim<WH669> is a cake<WH5692> not turned<WH2015>.
Strangers<WH2114> have devoured<WH398> his strength<WH3581>, and he knows<WH3045> it not<WH7872>: Yes, gray hairs are here and there<WH2236> upon him<WH3045>, yet he knows not.
And the pride<WH1347> of Israel<WH3478> testifies<WH6030> to his face<WH6440>: and they do not return<WH7725> to the Lord<WH3068> their God<WH430>, nor seek him for all this<WH1245>.
Ephraim<WH669> also is like a silly<WH6601> dove<WH3123> without heart<WH3820>: they call<WH7121> to Egypt<WH4714>, they go<WH1980> to Assyria<WH804>.

When they shall go<WH3212>, I will spread<WH6566> my net<WH7568> upon them<WH3381>; I will bring them down as the birds<WH5775> of the heaven<WH8064>; I will chastise<WH3256> them<WH5712>, as their congregation has heard<WH8088>.

Woe<WH188> unto them<WH5074>! for they have fled from me<WH7701>: destruction unto them<WH6586>! because they have transgressed against me<WH6299>: though I have redeemed them<WH1696>, yet they have spoken lies against me<WH3577>.

And they have not cried<WH2199> unto me with their heart<WH3820>, when they howled<WH3213> upon their beds<WH4904>: they assemble<WH1481> themselves for corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492>, and they rebel against me<WH5493>.
Though I have bound<WH3256> and strengthened<WH2388> their arms<WH2220>, yet do they imagine<WH2803> mischief against me<WH7451>.

They return<WH7725>, but not to the most High<WH5920>: they are like a deceitful<WH7423> bow<WH7198>: their princes<WH8269> shall fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719> for the rage<WH2195> of their tongue<WH3956>: this<WH2097> shall be their derision<WH3933> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.
